title: A Church Leader Wants to Stop Giving Money to ICE
summary: Cardinal Joseph Tobin is a top Catholic leader in the U.S. He is speaking out against ICE, which is a government group that handles immigration. He says ICE is doing bad things and should not get money from the government. He wants people in the church to tell lawmakers to stop funding ICE. This comes after some sad events, like a little boy being taken by agents. Cardinal Tobin believes it is important to see what is happening and take action based on his faith. He thinks ICE is not following the rules properly. He urges everyone to pay attention and help make changes.

background_read: Immigration is when people move to a new country to live. In the U.S., ICE is a group that enforces immigration laws. Sometimes, ICE takes actions that some people think are unfair or harmful. Cardinal Tobin is a religious leader who uses his faith to guide his opinions. He is asking others to help change how ICE is funded because he believes it is not acting properly. This is part of a bigger discussion about how to treat immigrants kindly and follow rules.
Article_Structure: WHO: Cardinal Joseph Tobin, a top Catholic leader in the U.S.
WHAT: He is urging people to stop giving money to ICE because he thinks it is doing bad things.
WHERE: This is happening in the United States, especially after events like a boy being detained in Texas.
WHY: He believes it is morally right to speak out and take action based on his faith to help immigrants.

perspectives.description: Cardinal Tobin uses his Catholic faith to argue that ICE's actions are wrong and that people should pressure lawmakers to defund it.
